main event: On 16 April 1952, several civilian witnesses in Madison, Wisconsin observed 5 or 6 yellowish-white semi-circular objects traveling at high speeds in the sky.
interesting points: The objects were seen making sharp turns and climbing rapidly,The sighting was reported to military authorities and involved multiple aircraft search efforts with negative results,The radar station was temporarily offline during the initial reports but became operational in minutes,Check with local airline flights and observatories revealed no identifiable aircraft or astronomical phenomena,Despite the presence of F-80 and F-86 military aircraft, the reported objects were not identified as those aircraft.
sighted object: five or six yellowish-white semi-circular objects
witness description: Civilian observers, including Mr. and Captain John R W Cambell, senior controller on duty.
